meanings.definition: Not permanent; not lasting or enduring.
meanings.sent1: The sandcastle was impermanently built and washed away by the tide.
meanings.sent2: The flowers in the garden are impermanently beautiful, blooming only for a short time.
meanings.sent3: The impermanently drawn smiley face on the foggy window made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her impermanently changing hair color reflected her ever-evolving personality.
meanings.sent5: The impermanently melting ice cream cone left sticky trails on the sidewalk.

meanings.definition: In a way that is not permanent or lasting.
meanings.sent1: The graffiti was impermanently sprayed on the wall and easily washed off.
meanings.sent2: She packed her bags impermanently, knowing she would return soon.
meanings.sent3: The magician impermanently made the rabbit disappear, only to bring it back with a flourish.
meanings.sent4: His words hung impermanently in the air, leaving a sense of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The snowflakes impermanently settled on the ground, creating a fleeting winter wonderland.
